Articles.Content:
I played KSP today like everyday, then I thought "it's so hard to build multi-purposal rover, but if I have motor or something it will way better than now".

So what if squad adds motor to KSP? Don't you think it's good and cool?

So, what I and some of my friends want is the motor. This is the full list of the motors I want.

-stack motor in various radii (radius)

-stack servo-motor in various radii

-radial motor in various sizes

-radial servo-motor in various sizes

-pistons,springs in various sizes
So you're trying to turn it into Kerbal Car Program? We already have rover wheels, we don't need every part in a combustion engine.
oh really? we have wheels so don't need motors? I didn't say about that motor.if you know what servo motor is, you would not say like that.
I'm not 100% clear what you mean either, and in fairness you did mention a rover in your first post. Do you mean to make moving parts other than wheels, like hinges and such?

I would indeed like more mechanical parts to be included. Not mainly for rovers, but for example for ground base construction. Then one could adapt the height of a docking port. This works at the moment a bit with the claw, as it can be used as flexible joint, but the claw is kraken bait and inferior to active moving parts for this purpose.

> 
> oh really? we have wheels so don't need motors? I didn't say about that motor.if you know what servo motor is, you would not say like that.

Well, you *did* mention pistons and springs, and those are parts in combustion engines. Combustion engines would not make a very good part for KSP. Hint: Combustion engines need oxygen. There's no oxygen anywhere but Kerbin and Laythe
